numlitem.para: Associated FCC SERVO circuit breaker is pulled and collared,
If FCC Single Source option is installed, Autopilot Flight Director System is verified not in a single source configuration prior to each departure, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.

note.para: Single Source Configuration not installed N401UP-N435UP.

numlitem.para: If autopilot engagement between 200’ and 500’ AGL is desired, ensure the AFDS is fully operational.
Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: Placard affected A/P Engage switch "INOP" or "MODE(S) INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: One System Inoperative (401UP-435UP) PW
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: Deferring a leaking Autopilot Electrohydraulic Servo Valve requires deactivating the associated Autopilot System.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the applicable Flight Control Computer (FCC) servo circuit breaker and placard.
For left FCC, open and collar this circuit breaker on the overhead circuit breaker panel P11:
FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO LEFT: 11E18
For center FCC, open and collar this circuit breaker on the overhead circuit breaker panel P11:
FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO CENTER: 11E21
For right FCC, open and collar this circuit breaker on the overhead circuit breaker panel P11:
FLT CONT CMPTR SERVO RIGHT: 11E36

Verify minimum number of FCC 115 VAC circuit breakers on the P11 overhead panel are closed for dispatch configuration. Dispatch is allowed if an inoperative FCC has a fault that trips it's circuit breaker provided the minimum number of FCC circuit breakers are closed, however, sensor data availability is maximized if all FCC breakers are closed.
FCC COMPTR PWR LEFT: 11E17
FCC COMPTR PWR CENTER: 11E20
FCC COMPTR PWR RIGHT: 11E35

note.para: The following steps should be accomplished only if the Autopilot System is to be deferred for a hydraulic leak.

numlitem.para: Autopilot Electrohydraulic Servo Valves (EHSV) Leaking:

note.para: The following procedure is generic for the three Elevator Autopilot Servo (EAS) Electrohydraulic Valves and the three Directional Autopilot Servo (DAS) Electrohydraulic Valves.

numlitem.para: Remove applicable hydraulic pressure at panel P5.
Left EAS/DAS - Left hydraulic system.
Center EAS/DAS - Center hydraulic system.
Right EAS/DAS -Right hydraulic system.
Set panel P61 switches L, C, R TAIL FLT CONTROL SHUTOFF to OFF.
Set the two P10 control stand STAB TRIM switches to CUTOUT.
Set the Mode Control Panel F/D switches to OFF.
Open the following circuit breakers on the P11 panel:

entry.para: FLT CONTROL SHUTOFF TAIL L, C, R
FLT CONT CMPTR PWR L, C, R
FLT CONT CMPTR SERV L, C, R

numlitem.para: Gain access to the leaky EAS/DAS (Autopilot servo).
Remove the pressure and return lines from the autopilot servo.
Cap autopilot servo ports with BACC14AG plugs or equivalent.
Cap the hydraulic lines with MS21914 or BAC14AD 3,000 psi (CRES or titanium) caps or equivalent.
Close the circuit breakers from step E.
Set MCP F/D switches to ON.
Set STAB TRIM switches to NORM.
Set L, C, R TAIL FLT CONTROL SHUTOFF to ON.
Perform the steps under “Autopilot Inoperative”, in following for the number of autopilots rendered inoperative.
